The plant is adapted to arid environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food and shelter for various insects and birds. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.

Due to its restricted habitat, Acacia amaliae is considered a rare and endemic plant in these regions.
